normalised: Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Virality Trends
Namaste, folks! Ever wondered what makes something go chakachak viral on desi social media? Well, the trends are shifting faster than a Mumbai local at nine o'clock hours!

unnormalised: Namaste, folks! Ever wondered what makes something go *chakachak* viral on desi social media? Well, the trends are shifting faster than a Mumbai local at 09:00 hrs!
normalised: Forget perfectly polished content. Authenticity is the new black. Think relatable reels shot on a phone, not fancy film productions. We are seeing a surge in hyperlocal content - stories from gali cricket matches in Jaipur to chai stalls near I I T Delhi are racking up views.

unnormalised: Forget perfectly polished content. Authenticity is the new black. Think relatable reels shot on a phone, not fancy film productions. We're seeing a surge in hyperlocal content - stories from gali cricket matches in Jaipur to chai stalls near IIT Delhi are racking up views.
normalised: Challenges are still big, but they need a unique desi twist. Think "The Biryani Eating Challenge" instead of the generic ones. Remember that "Rasode Mein Kaun Tha" clip from two thousand and twenty? Pure gold!

unnormalised: Challenges are still big, but they need a unique desi twist. Think "The Biryani Eating Challenge" instead of the generic ones. Remember that "Rasode Mein Kaun Tha" clip from 2020? Pure gold!
normalised: Brands are taking notice too. Instead of splurging on Bollywood celebs, micro-influencers from smaller towns are proving to be R O I champions. They have got that personal touch, connecting deeply with their audience. Plus, live streams are booming, especially around festive times like Diwali on twenty fourth october and Holi on eighth march two thousand and twenty four. Keep an eye out for that! So, ditch the templates and embrace the desi! It is working wonders.
